abstract: German club of computer hackers announces that it has analyzed the hard drives of people who had been investigated by German state authorities and discovered that the drives were infected with spying software that gave the police the ability to log keystrokes, capture screenshots and activate cameras and microphones; public condemnation is swift and strong, igniting a debate into how far the government can intrude into digital privacy.
snippet: A hacker group prompted a public outcry after finding that German state investigators were using software capable of turning personal computers into surveillance devices.
lead_paragraph: A hacker group prompted a public outcry after finding that German state investigators were using software capable of turning personal computers into surveillance devices.

headline.main: Germans Condemn Police Use of Spyware

headline.seo: Uproar in Germany on Police Use of Surveillance Software
